docs.title: Command Component

docs.text: Minecraft Version Updated on Minecraft 1.19.10 Command on Gametest return object containing some command data. [Script] Example code let command = "give @a apple 1 0" let data = player . runCommand ( command ) Every command will return statusCode and statusMessage with additional property every commands Example command property { // S tatus code i n dica t i n g i f t he comma n d work or n o t // 0 : Success // -2147352576 : Error "statusCode" : 0 , // S tatus message is t he message ou t pu t fr om t he comma n d "statusCode" : "<Message/Output from the command>" } Unexecutable command will throw error to the content log containing stringify object of command error property. Use try catch to take the data. This document will show you which command will throw error with [Error] code
docs.title: Command Component
Ability

docs.text: Add camera shake to the player Command: /camerashake add @s { "player" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Send a request to the following players for their camera to shake: FrankyRayMS" } Stop camera shake to the player Command: /camerashake add @s { "player" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Stopping the camera shake for the following players: FrankyRayMS" }
docs.title: Camerashake

docs.text: Clear player's inventory when there's any item Command: /clear { "itemsRemoved" : [ "64" ], "player" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Cleared the inventory of FrankyRayMS, removing 64 items" } Clear player's inventory when no item [Error] Command: /clear { "itemsRemoved" : [ "0" ], "player" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "Could not clear the inventory of {player}, no items to remove" } Check item's amount on the player with amount set to 0 Command: /clear @s diamond 0 0 { "playerTest" : [ "FrankyRayMS (64)" ], "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "FrankyRayMS has 64 items that match the criteria" }
docs.title: Clear

docs.text: Successfully clone the area Command: /clone 0 0 0 0 3 0 0 10 0 { "count" : 4 , "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "4 block cloned" } No block cloned [Error] { "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "No blocks cloned" } Source and destination area are overlap (without filtered force ) [Error] Command: /clone 0 0 0 0 3 0 0 2 0 { "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "Source and destination can not overlap" } Trying accessing block outside world [Error] Command: /clone 0 -1 0 0 3 0 0 10 0 { "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "Cannot access blocks outside of the world" } [Personal] Test failed Test again for /clone error: "Too many blocks in the specific area (%1$d > %2$d)" Max blocks (from Minecraft Wiki): 524288 blocks
docs.title: Clone

docs.text: Similar command: /wsserver Gametest Error Gametest didn't support /connect due to lowest permission level (required 2, got 1) and restriction Command: /connect 1 { "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "Unknown command: wsserver. Please check that the command exists and that you have permission to use it." }
docs.title: Connect

docs.text: Successfully damage the target Command: /damage @s 1 fall { "hurtActors" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Applied damage to FrankyRayMS" } Cannot damage the target [Error] Command: /damage @s 1 fall [Creative] { "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Could not apply damage to FrankyRayMS" , "unhurtActors" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ] } Too many damage sources [Error] Command: /damage @s 1 entity_attack entity @e { "statusCode" : -214735276 , "statusMessage" : "There can only be one source entity. Please adjust your selector to limit selection to one entity." } Info Command still run perfectly even there's unhurtable target/entity. The data will returned both hurtActors and unhurtActors . Command: /damage @e 1 fall { "hurtActors" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Applied damage to FrankyRayMS\nCould not apply damage to Armor Stand" , "unhurtActors" : [ "Armor Stand" ] }
docs.title: Damage

docs.text: Gametest Error Gametest didn't support /deop due to lowest permission level (required 2, got 1) Command: /deop @s { "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "Unknown command: deop. Please check that the command exists and that you have permission to use it." }
docs.title: Deop

docs.text: Command: /difficulty p { "difficulty" : "PEACEFUL" , "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Set game difficulty to PEACEFUL" } List of "difficulty" value difficulty : - PEACEFUL - EASY - NORMAL - HARD
docs.title: Difficulty

docs.text: Successfully give effect to target Command: /effect @s saturation { "amplifier" : 0 , "effect" : "saturation" , "player" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "seconds" : 30 , "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Gave Saturation * 0 to FrankyRayMS for 30 seconds" } Clears all effect from target Command: effect @s clear { "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Took all effect from FrankyRaymS" } Clears no effect on the target [Error] Command: /effect @s clear { "player" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "Couldn't take any effects from FrankyRayMS as they do not have any" }
docs.title: Effect

docs.text: Successfully enchant an item Command: /enchant @s sharpness 5 { "playerName" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Enchanting succeeded for FrankyRayMS" } Combining incompatible enchantment [Error] Command: /enchant @s smite 5 { "playerNames" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "Smite can't be combined with Sharpness" } Too high enchantment's level [Error] Command: /enchant @s sharpness 10 { "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Sharpness does not support level 10" } Add enchantment into incompatible item [Error] Command: /enchant @s fortune 1 { "playerNames" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "The selected enchantment can't be added to the target item: Fortune" } Player didn't hold any item [Error] { "playerNames" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "The target doesn't hold an item: FrankyRayMS" } [Personal] Re-check Recheck returned data from /enchant (Error only)
docs.title: Enchant

docs.text: Successfully fill the area Command: /fill 0 0 0 3 3 3 wool 10 { "blockName" : "Purple Wool" , "fillCount" : 16 , "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "16 blocks filled" } Fill 0 blocks [Error] Command: /fill 0 0 0 0 0 0 wool 10 replace wool 0 { "blockName" : "Purple Wool" , "fillCount" : 0 , "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "0 blocks filled" } Place blocks outside of the world [Error] Command: /fill 0 -1 0 0 0 0 wool 10 { "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "Cannot place blocks outside of the world" } Too many blocks to fill [Error] Command: /fill 0 0 0 50 50 50 wool 10 { "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "Too many blocks in the specified area (132651 > 32768)" }
docs.title: Fill

docs.text: Successfully change player's gamemode Command: /gamemode spectator { "gamemode" : "%createWorldScreen.gameMode.spectator" , "player" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Set FrankyRayMS's gamemode to Spectator" } List of "gamemode" value with the right gamemode name gamemode : - Creative : "%createWorldScreen.gameMode.creative" - Survival : "%createWorldScreen.gameMode.survival" - Adventure : "%createWorldScreen.gameMode.adventure" - Default : "%createWorldScreen.gameMode.serverDefault" - Spectator : "%createWorldScreen.gameMode.spectator"
docs.title: Gamemode

docs.text: Update the value of game rule (Boolean) /gamerule commandblockoutput false { "name" : "commandblockoutput" , "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Game rule commandblockoutput has been updated to false" , "value" : false } Update the value of game rule (Integer/Number) /gamerule randomtickspeed 4 { "name" : "randomtickspeed" , "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Game rule randomtickspeed has been updated to 4" , "value" : 4 }
docs.title: Gamerule

docs.text: Successfully give an item to player Command: /give @s apple { "itemAmount" : 1 , "itemName" : "Apple" , "playerName" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Gave Apple * 1 to FrankyRayMS" }
docs.title: Give

docs.text: Similar command: /? Show help (Page) Command: /help 1 { "body" : "<Too long message; Similar to statusMessage, output of command message>" } Show help (Command) Command: /help camerashake { "command" : "camerashake:" , "description" : "%commands.screenshake.description" , "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "<Too long message>" }
docs.title: Help

docs.text: Trying to kick operator/admin of the world [Error] Command: /kick FrankyRayMS { "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "The host may not be kicked from the game." } [Public] Need test Need testing for successful kicking player from the world
docs.title: Kick

docs.text: Successfully kill the target Command: /kill @a { "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Killed Cow, Chicken, Egg, Skeleton, Skeleton, Chicken, Cow" , "targetname" : [ "Cow" , "Chicken" , "Egg" , "Skeleton" , "Skeleton" , "Chicken" , "Cow" ] } Cannot kill the target/no unkillable target [Error] Command: /kill @s { "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "No targets matched selector" }
docs.title: Kill

docs.text: Locating structure Command: /locate ancientcity || /locate structure ancientcity { "destination" : { "x" : 1352 , "y" : 64 , "z" : -1848 }, "feature" : "%feature.ancientcity" , "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "The nearest Ancient City is at block 1352, (y?), -1848 (2304 blocks away)" } Locating biome Command: /locate biome plains { "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "The nearest plains is at block -101, 63, -210 (243 blocks away)" } [Personal/Public] Need Test Need testing for check unreachable structure/biome location "No valid structure found within a reasonable distance"
docs.title: Locate

docs.text: Gametest Error Gametest cannot run /loot for no reason. Command: /loot give @s loot custom_loot_test { "statusCode" : -2147352576 }
docs.title: Loot

docs.text: Similar command: /tell and /w Command: /msg Hello! { "message" : "Hello!" , "recipient" : [ "FrankyRayMS" ], "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "You whisper to FrankyRayMS: Hello!" }
docs.title: Msg

docs.text: Gametest Error Gametest didn't support /op due to lowest permission level (required 2, got 1) Command: /op @s { "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "Unknown command: op. Please check that the command exists and that you have permission to use it." }
docs.title: OP

docs.text: Gametest Error Gametest didn't support /reload due to lowest permission level (required 2, got 1) Command: /reload @s { "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "Unknown command: reload. Please check that the command exists and that you have permission to use it." }
docs.title: Reload

docs.text: Successfully set block Command: /setblock 0 0 0 stone { "position" : { "x" : 0 , "y" : 0 , "z" : 0 }, "statusCode" : 0 , "statusMessage" : "Block placed" }
docs.title: Setblock

docs.text: Gametest Error Gametest didn't support /setmaxplayers due to lowest permission level (required 3, got 1) Command: /setmaxplayers @s { "statusCode" : -2147352576 , "statusMessage" : "Unknown command: setmaxplayers. Please check that the command exists and that you have permission to use it." }
docs.title: Setmaxplayers
